alert.note: Alert for Curry County Coast; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 17 at 3:54PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...A line of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Curry and west central Josephine Counties through 445 PM PDT... At 352 PM PDT, trained weather spotters reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Agness to 32 miles west of Jack McNamera Field. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Hail could cover the ground, causing slippery roads. Locations impacted include... Brookings, Harris Beach State Park, Harbor, Alfred A. Loeb State Park and Pistol River. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Curry County Coast; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County
